page.title: 01TARRANT VALLEY - OVERVIEW
page.content: Looking down from the NW corner of our block one can see the whole landscape unfolded before us.To the SW is Blandford Army Camp where the Signals Regiment is stationed.Our vantage point in the NW corner is a 30 metre prehistoric Long Barrow.As the valley slopes down to the Tarrant Stream the feild pattern is clear.Feilds of crops lie interspersed with grasslands,for pasture and hay silage.Clumps of woodland are spaced out haphazardly among the fields.The settlements are strung out along a minor road which follows the chalk stream.Where the road meets the A354 Salisbury - Blandford road is Tarrant Hinton. Further down the valley are the villages of Tarrant launceston and the Old World village of Tarrant Monkton with its thatched cottages.
